summary: W. R. Wannall was involved in the FBI's responses to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) investigations in the mid-1970s, specifically concerning SENSTUDY 75. His role included coordinating responses to congressional inquiries and providing documents related to FBI activities, including FBI-CIA liaison activities, COINTELPRO, and investigations into Martin Luther King Jr. He was a recipient or sender of memoranda regarding the declassification and release of information to the SSC. One document mentions a memorandum from W. G. Cregar to W. R. Wannall regarding a CIA document detailing questionable activities involving both the CIA and FBI, which was under review by the SSC.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Medium. W. R. Wannall appears in a significant number of documents (41), indicating some level of involvement in the FBI's activities related to congressional oversight and sensitive investigations. While the documents do not explicitly link him to the JFK assassination, his involvement in responding to the SSC's inquiries on topics like COINTELPRO and FBI-CIA liaison suggests a role in handling potentially controversial information.
